//Services Students and staff can make use of the following services that are available on campus:
Minor ailments Quick consultations for common health issues like headaches, minor injuries, or stomach troubles. Ideal for addressing small health concerns without a full doctor\'s appointment. We also offer expert care for issues affecting the ear, nose, and throat, as well as eye conditions, skin conditions & sexually transmitted diseases. Ear, Nose, and Throat Conditions: Expert care for issues affecting the ear, nose, and throat, such as ear infections, sinus problems, or sore throats. Skin Conditions: Consultations and treatments for various skin concerns, from rashes and minor irritations to skin infections. Sexually Transmitted Infections: Confidential testing, diagnosis, and treatment for sexually transmitted infections, ensuring privacy and comprehensive care. Eye Conditions: Services related to eye health, covering issues like red eyes, minor infections, or other non-severe eye conditions. Keep an eye out for our regular health campaigns that will provide you with the necessary information to keep you in good shape.
Chronic medication Prescribed drugs and treatments designed for the long-term management of ongoing medical conditions. Management and dispensing of medications for chronic conditions, ensuring continuity of care. Antiretroviral (ART) medication: Antiretroviral medication is a specific category of chronic drugs used in the treatment of HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus) infection. ART works by suppressing the replication of the virus, slowing down the progression of HIV to AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome), and helping individuals with HIV lead healthier and longer lives. Pre-exposure Prophylaxis (PrEP): Pre-exposure prophylaxis is a preventive medication strategy aimed at reducing the risk of contracting certain infections, primarily HIV, before potential exposure. In the context of HIV prevention, PrEP involves taking specific antiretroviral medications regularly to lower the chances of acquiring the virus, particularly for individuals at high risk of exposure. It is a proactive approach to safeguarding against infection."
Screenings Prescribed drugs and treatments designed for the long-term management of ongoing medical conditions. Management and dispensing of medications for chronic conditions, ensuring continuity of care. Cholesterol Cholesterol is a fatty substance in your blood. Monitoring cholesterol levels is vital for heart health. Knowing your cholesterol status can guide lifestyle choices and dietary habits, promoting a heart-friendly life.
